programme.title: KAU DITAKDIRKAN UNTUKKU 58 [P13]
programme.desc: Alya is a tough, independent tomboy girl. He must care for his mother, who has kidney disease, in a life full of challenges. Alya must provide for her family's living expenses in addition to caring for her mother and nephew. After that, he endured difficult work and had to confront the sometimes-difficult realities.

programme.title: IPA & IPS EPS 394 [P13]
programme.desc: IPA & IPS tells about school children in choosing different school majors. As is known, each high school has two majors to choose from, namely IPA (Natural Science) and IPS (Social Sciences). There are two friends who choose different majors so that their friendship is split, even both of them make science and social science students enemies. It started with two friends, Rifki and Aldino who became enemies because they chose different majors

programme.title: CINTA TANPA KARENA EPS 134 [P13]
programme.desc: Couple of lovers who are prevented from being together by their parents' approval. They are Dipta (Megantara) and Nuna (Ochi Rosdiana), and they must maintain their love in secret. Due to Nuna's mother's blockade, their love tale must overcome numerous challenges

programme.title: CINTA YASMIN EPS 180-181 [P13]
programme.desc: Yasmin is a lovely, kind, and diligent woman. Unfortunately, life doesn't appear to be on her side as she pursues her dream of becoming a successful professional woman. Can Yasmin merely dream about her dream, or will she be able to make it a reality?

programme.title: IKATAN CINTA EPS 1233 [P13]
programme.desc: It tells the story of Aldebaran (Arya Saloka) who initially wanted to avenge the death of his sister and ended up marrying Andin (Amanda Manopo) who was imprisoned due to accusations by his sister, Elsa (Glenca Chysara). When all is revealed, Elsa is serving her sentence because she is the real culprit. Nino (Evan Sanders) who is Andin's ex-husband is now obsessed with Reyna, his daughter and Andin. Al Fahri's family survived and their happiness increased with the birth of Askara. Watch today's episode of Bond of Love!

programme.title: MENCINTAIMU SEKALI LAGI EPS 197 [P13]
programme.desc: Arini, a successful woman, faces deep wounds due to her lover, Donny's affair with her best friend, Laura. Alya must provide for her family's living expenses in addition to caring for her mother and nephew. After that, he endured difficult work and had to confront the sometimes-difficult realities.

programme.title: IPA & IPS EPS 395 [P13]
programme.desc: IPA & IPS tells about school children in choosing different school majors. As is known, each high school has two majors to choose from, namely IPA (Natural Science) and IPS (Social Sciences). There are two friends who choose different majors so that their friendship is split, even both of them make science and social science students enemies. It started with two friends, Rifki and Aldino who became enemies because they chose different majors

programme.title: CINTA TANPA KARENA EPS 135-136 [P13]
programme.desc: Couple of lovers who are prevented from being together by their parents' approval. They are Dipta (Megantara) and Nuna (Ochi Rosdiana), and they must maintain their love in secret. Due to Nuna's mother's blockade, their love tale must overcome numerous challenges

programme.title: CINTA YASMIN EPS 182 [P13]
programme.desc: Yasmin is a lovely, kind, and diligent woman. Unfortunately, life doesn't appear to be on her side as she pursues her dream of becoming a successful professional woman. Can Yasmin merely dream about her dream, or will she be able to make it a reality?

programme.title: IKATAN CINTA EPS 1234 [P13]
programme.desc: It tells the story of Aldebaran (Arya Saloka) who initially wanted to avenge the death of his sister and ended up marrying Andin (Amanda Manopo) who was imprisoned due to accusations by his sister, Elsa (Glenca Chysara). When all is revealed, Elsa is serving her sentence because she is the real culprit. Nino (Evan Sanders) who is Andin's ex-husband is now obsessed with Reyna, his daughter and Andin. Al Fahri's family survived and their happiness increased with the birth of Askara. Watch today's episode of Bond of Love!

programme.title: MENCINTAIMU SEKALI LAGI EPS 198 [P13]
programme.desc: Arini, a successful woman, faces deep wounds due to her lover, Donny's affair with her best friend, Laura. In her slump, her mother tries to match her with Lingga, the son of their family friend. Although initially refusing, Arini begins to open her heart thanks to Lingga's sincerity.

programme.title: TERBELENGGU RINDU EPS 320 [P13]
programme.desc: The tale of Amira, a stunning, kind, and kind woman who always has an optimistic outlook on life. Her life was good at first, but she became too depressed to live after the deaths of her husband and daughter, as well as other issues that kept happening.

programme.title: TAIWAN PROFESSIONAL BASKETBALL LEAGUE (WEEKDAYS) [U]
programme.desc: The Taiwan Professional Basketball League (TPBL) is Taiwan’s premier professional basketball league, bringing elite players, passionate fans, and world-class entertainment to create an electrifying basketball experience. Featuring seven dynamic teams—Taipei Mars, New Taipei Kings, New Taipei CTBC DEA, Taoyuan Taiwan Beer Leopards, Hsinchu Toplus Lioneers, Formosa Dreamers, and Kaohsiung Aquas—TPBL showcases high-intensity competition and unforgettable moments on the court. With a commitment to excellence, innovation, and fan engagement, TPBL is shaping the future of professional basketball in Asia and inspiring the next generation of athletes.

programme.desc: The Dinosaur Echo is a documentary about the renaissance of paleontology in Canada today and what dinosaurs can teach us about climate change.

programme.title: Black In Space: Breaking The Color Barrier [U]
programme.desc: The Civil Rights Movement collided with the Space Race as America battled to beat the Soviets to become the first nation to send a black astronaut into orbit.

programme.title: Air Warriors S11 [U]
programme.desc: This documentary series shows five generations of jet engines. These fighter jets are capable of carrying bombs and soar close to the edge of space. The sixth generation of fighter jets began in 2020, and the 11th season has covered most of the air artillery since then.

programme.title: Air Warriors S11 [U]

programme.title: Costa Rica: The Rise Of Nature [U]
programme.desc: Join us on a journey to the heart of Costa Rica, to discover several fabulous Eden-like biotopes, and see the unprecedented efforts that are made every day to preserve, and in some cases restore, this exceptional natural heritage.

programme.title: Costa Rica: The Rise Of Nature [U]
programme.desc: Join us on a journey to the heart of Costa Rica, to discover several fabulous Eden-like biotopes, and see the unprecedented efforts that are made every day to preserve, and in some cases restore, this exceptional natural heritage.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Great White Shark [U]
programme.desc: Reptiles, amphibians, insects and fish are found in every corner of our world - and for this special group of animals, life is regulated by the sun.

programme.title: Canada: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: With days growing shorter and colder, Canadian wildlife is in a race against time, and any animal that fails to make the most of what autumn has to offer will perish.

programme.title: Canada: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: Winter in Canada is both cruel and beautiful; in the grip of snow and ice, and animals are struggling; however, while some animals hunker down, others have babies to raise who need to adjust to their environment swiftly.

programme.title: Canada: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: Spring is late this year, and when it finally arrives, the race is on to find a mate and start a family; black bears and beavers in the west, wood frogs in the south and 20,000 gannets in the east all have one thing on their minds.

programme.title: Canada: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: With days growing shorter and colder, Canadian wildlife is in a race against time, and any animal that fails to make the most of what autumn has to offer will perish.

programme.title: Naledi: A Baby Elephant's Tale [U]
programme.desc: Naledi follows the journey of a baby elephant orphaned in a rescue camp, as the man tasked with her survival races to protect an entire species while fighting to save her life.

programme.title: Attenborough's Life In Colour [U]
programme.desc: Millions of years ago, the first animals had eyes that were unable to distinguish color -- yet as that changed, ‘seeing in color’ gave animals many advantages, whether to find food, attract a mate or warn off an enemy.

programme.title: Attenborough's Life In Colour [U]
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals some of the natural world’s most cunning tricksters and masters of disguise. Discover how some animals use color to hide and disappear into the background, or to trick and deceive.

programme.title: Leguizamo Does America [U]
programme.desc: John starts his travels by visiting with up-and-coming trans reggaeton artist, Villano Antillano, who is changing the face and the rules of the game with her music and her existence.

programme.title: Leguizamo Does America [U]
programme.desc: John starts his trip by driving to east L.A. with native Angelino, George Lopez.

programme.title: United Plates Of America [U]
programme.desc: Lurking beneath the waters of the northwest is some of the best seafood in the country and in fact, the world. We meet the original custodians of the areas and we taste the food they helped them thrive in this region. Seattle’s seafood scene has grown into one of the best in the world.

programme.title: United Plates Of America [U]
programme.desc: We kick off with a Greek restaurant that specialises in seafood. We go north up to Harlem to try a new eatery with a New York foodie and we try the delectable tastes of the world’s first fine-dining restaurant, all here in New York.

programme.title: Kamala Harris: The Next President [U]
programme.desc: This documentary explores Kamala Harris's rise from her early life in California to becoming the first female Vice President of the United States, her impact on American politics, and her potential path to becoming the first female President.

programme.title: ABBA: 50 Years Since Eurovision [U]
programme.desc: Chronicling ABBA's rise from Eurovision to global stardom, their iconic sound, record-breaking success, solo endeavors, ABBA Gold revival, and cutting-edge hologram tour "Voyage" that reunited the virtual band.

programme.title: Janet Jackson: The Art Of Seduction [U]
programme.desc: Noted for her fierce independence, her magnetic aura and her ever so charming voice, Janet Jackson became a catalyst for her growth on MTV; embracing her identity, and reaching up to the heights of stardom.

programme.title: Williams Sisters [U]
programme.desc: The Williams Sisters. Never before has a surname rang so synonymously with the sport of tennis. From inexperienced teenagers to seasoned vets nobody could have predicted the sisters’ careers, or could they?

programme.title: Rafael Nadal: King Of Clay [U]
programme.desc: This documentary delves into the life of tennis legend Rafael Nadal, exploring his journey from a young prodigy to a global icon. Through triumphs and challenges, it reveals the dedication that defines Nadal’s legacy on and off the court.

programme.title: Roger Federer: A Champion's Journey [U]
programme.desc: Wimbledon Stadium’s Honour Board is full of illustrious names. And in 1998, another emerged. Roger Federer. His journey to the top of the men’s game is the one of a true champion, in every sense of the word.

programme.title: Novak Djokovic: Refuse To Lose [U]
programme.desc: Born in war-torn Belgrade, Serbia, Novak Djokovic developed his skills in some of the harshest conditions imaginable. Despite this, he rose to the top of the professional tennis rankings, becoming a national icon and a symbol of unity for the Siberian people.

programme.title: David Beckham: Infamous [U]
programme.desc: David Beckham, a household name, footballing icon and at one point the most hated man in England. A comprehensive look at David Beckhams footballing career focusing on his England redemption, World Cup dreams, trial by media and becoming brand Becks.

programme.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: The One And Only [U]
programme.desc: Witness the journey from the young Portuguese prodigy to one of the greatest players of all time. This is the one and only...Cristiano Ronaldo.

programme.title: JLo: Triple Threat [U]

programme.title: Beyonce: Queen & Country [U]
programme.desc: Follow the life and career of Beyoncé Knowles-Carter, from her early days as the lead singer of Destiny's Child to her solo career. Discover how the superstar's music style and inspirations have developed over the years.

programme.title: Alaska: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: Humpback whales return to Alaska's rich feeding grounds and salmon return to spawn in the rivers. The returning salmon however have to negotiate a path past hungry brown bears.

programme.title: Alaska: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: The end of winter heralds one of the world's greatest feeding frenzies as large ocean predators target the millions of fish who have found refuge in the Gulf of Alaska.

programme.title: Alaska: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: With the arrival of spring, days grow longer and temperatures rise. However, spring in Alaska is short. Animals have just two months to find food and start a family, while avoiding predators.

programme.title: United Plates Of America [U]

programme.title: United Plates Of America [U]
programme.desc: Starting in Tampa, at Ulele, a rustic chic restaurant with native Floridian fare, is named after a Native American princess. We then head to Orlando where we experience a mouth watering meal at a plant-based deli cafe, Market On South.

programme.title: United Plates Of America [U]
programme.desc: We visit Seattle to try a seafood restaurant with an amazing view of the city, then head to Portland to try some genuine Russian food, with a Portland legend. Then back to Seattle to sample some world cuisine.

programme.title: United Plates Of America [U]
programme.desc: Kicking off in beautiful Detroit, we meet a local foodie and try some hipster fare. Then off to Cleveland Ohio where we sink our teeth into some amazing barbecue.Then we’ll sample the best chicken and waffles Cleveland has to offer.

programme.title: United Plates Of America [U]
programme.desc: Head into the hot American desert to try Cuban food at the magnificent Scott Resort. Then on to the Vegas strip and taste some mouth watering steak. and we eat some magnificent tortilla’s from the back of a food truck.

programme.title: Building The Impossible [U]
programme.desc: Rob journeys along the length of the Panama Canal to learn how the un-conquerable Isthmus was bent to the will and skill of determined engineers, creating one of the seven wonders of the Modern World.

programme.title: Building The Impossible [U]
programme.desc: From stormy seas to the land locked Mojave Desert, Rob discovers the amazing story of how the mighty Colorado was tamed and the Hoover Dam built.

programme.title: Building The Impossible [U]
programme.desc: Travelling to the North of Scotland, Rob discovers the story of the British Oil Industry though it’s incredible engineering; from first oil to today’s innovative rigs.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s food journey starts in the West Coast of the South Island. He meets the only NZ cranberry producer at a farm in Hokitika and travels to Blackball to learn how chorizo is made. He cooks a range of dishes at the beach incorporating these local delicacies, matched with a local beer.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben visits High Peak Station in Canterbury and learns of their high -country farm to fork experience and tales of multigenerational stewardship. On the wild Tora Coast he meets a couple who harvest kaimoana sustainably – launching their fishing boat into the sea using a bulldozer.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s travels to Hastings and discovers a holistic fully vertically integrated approach to creating grass fed Angus beef. He ventures to the local farmers market and meets amazing local food producers, reinforcing the abundance of produce grown in the region.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s meets an Orchardist and Food Innovation specialist. They have a shared vision to make all natural varietal – led apple juice, using the best technology in the world. He also checks out over 30 varieties of figs grown in the Mediterranean type climate of Hawkes Bay.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s food journey starts in the West Coast of the South Island. He meets the only NZ cranberry producer at a farm in Hokitika and travels to Blackball to learn how chorizo is made. He cooks a range of dishes at the beach incorporating these local delicacies, matched with a local beer.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s meets an Orchardist and Food Innovation specialist. They have a shared vision to make all natural varietal – led apple juice, using the best technology in the world. He also checks out over 30 varieties of figs grown in the Mediterranean type climate of Hawkes Bay.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben takes a boat to visit a salmon farm in Akaroa and learns the difference between NZ King and Atlantic salmon. He catches salmon and cooks it on the shoreline overlooking the harbour. He checks out a high-quality homegrown culinary oil that’s both healthy and versatile, highlighting a commitment to local agriculture and sustainability.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: It’s stone fruit season! Ben visits a family run orchard in Central Otago known for its long season of stone fruit and a strong connection to the land and community. He discovers an all-electric cherry farm where premium export cherries are sold direct to Kiwis.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben experiences the Ruapehu’s region emerging food story and rich history of market gardening. He meets a sixth generation farmer who has turned a remote wilderness into a thriving eco-tourism and fine dining destination, alongside an award winning chef.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s food journey starts in the West Coast of the South Island. He meets the only NZ cranberry producer at a farm in Hokitika and travels to Blackball to learn how chorizo is made. He cooks a range of dishes at the beach incorporating these local delicacies, matched with a local beer.

programme.title: Beyonce: Queen & Country [U]
programme.desc: Follow the life and career of Beyoncé Knowles-Carter, from her early days as the lead singer of Destiny's Child to her solo career. Discover how the superstar's music style and inspirations have developed over the years.

programme.title: East Asia Tonight
programme.desc: Spotlight on East Asia, a region steeped in history and now helping to write the future of our world. We'll break down the key stories and explain why they matter.

programme.title: Undercover Asia S12: In the Grip Of The Game
programme.desc: CNA's award-winning investigative series Undercover Asia returns with a new season to uncover the hard truths in the underbelly of Asia, and help us understand the plight of the disenfranchised and the displaced.

programme.title: Singapore Tonight
programme.desc: From business to politics, health to technology, the latest news from Singapore and analysis of the impact.

programme.title: Singapore Hour
programme.desc: From street food to smart tech, traditions to trending lifestyles, Singapore Hour is your ultimate insider’s guide to travel, work, and play in the Lion City.

programme.title: Asia Tonight
programme.desc: CNA correspondents bring you the top stories of the day with 'live' reports and interviews to keep you up-to-date on the day’s events.

programme.title: Debt Bomb
programme.desc: When Sri Lanka defaulted on its foreign debt for the first time in its history in 2022, it sparked fears of more sovereign defaults to come. We look at the human cost when a country goes bankrupt, and investigate the so-called debt traps.

programme.title: Singapore Tonight
programme.desc: From business to politics, health to technology, the latest news from Singapore and analysis of the impact.

programme.title: Asia First

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: My Street Piano
programme.desc: Hirosaki City in Aomori Prefecture is known for its Western architecture. A piano is placed inside the station, and people stop to play from their heart.

programme.title: GRAND SUMO Highlights
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from September 23, Day 10 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Tokyo.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Experience the fascinating sights of the airports and transport hubs which connect Japan with the world. Time-lapse photography will show you how these places bustle with activity around the clock.

programme.title: Dining With the Chef
programme.desc: In the city of Akashi, octopus shapes tradition. Chef Hayashi meets local guardians, and unveils a rice dish with an inventive combination of flavors: octopus and umeboshi-the soul of Japan.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: CINEMATIC JOURNEY
programme.desc: Join our explorers as they pursue the cinematic beauty of Japan. Kyle Card hikes the newly designated long trail around majestic Mt. Fuji and discovers its secrets.

programme.title: AMAMI: Biodiversity
programme.desc: Amami Oshima is a World Natural Heritage Site, with rare flora and fauna including many endemic species. Explore the biodiversity of its lush, subtropical forests in stunning time-lapse footage.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Through research on the calls of the Japanese tit, Suzuki Toshitaka has proven that animals other than humans have language capabilities. He talks about pioneering the field of animal linguistics.

programme.title: IMPACTS:Climates Change the World
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a variety of short programs focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Good or Evil Soul
programme.desc: We visit the Yoshiwara district, Edo's most prominent pleasure quarters. Among the lavish spenders, courtesans and apprentices, small humanoid creatures scurry about - what could they be up to?

programme.title: Today's Close-Up
programme.desc: A nationwide inspection of Japan's aging sewer pipes has uncovered dangerous deterioration in many places, largely in urban areas. We investigate the threat and see how authorities are responding.

programme.title: Document 72 hours
programme.desc: A 24-hour gas station with prices that entice drivers from both near and far. From a couple who travels and sleeps in their car to a professional driver, join us as we listen to customers' stories.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Participants of the Hyoge Festival clown around in fun, silly costumes. It originated as a sly way of thanking a local hero, who built reservoirs but was exiled in the 17th century.

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The nuns of Otowasan Kannonji Temple teach us how to make shinoda rolls with taro stalks, a simple fall dish suitable for festive occasions.

programme.title: Science View
programme.desc: This episode looks at Japan's leading shipping innovations, such as the world's first electric tanker and fuel-saving "air lubrication." Also, out-of-body illusions.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: On New Year's Eve, performers dress as monsters called namahage. It's a good-natured tradition that strengthens family and community bonds. And in the village of Tayazawa, it was recently revived.

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Tsutaju
programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode takes a close look at artist Utamaro's iconic "Woman with a Glass Noisemaker."

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.desc: Photographer Alfie Goodrich heads to Yakushima, a mystical island of ancient Yakusugi trees. He traces the steps of a famous British plant-hunter and meets stewards of the land.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony #1 Spring
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Tsutaju
programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode features ukiyo-e artist Sharaku's "The Actor Ichikawa Ebizo as Takemura Sadanoshin."

programme.title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Gojinjo Taiko is a wild, powerful performance by masked drummers. It originated 400 years ago, when villagers disguised themselves as oni (demons) to scare away a warlord's army.

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The nuns of Otowasan Kannonji Temple show us how to make a simple fall treat that's both beautiful to look at and tasty to eat. Just boil edible chrysanthemums and serve with sweet vinegar.
